thread.title: Karen G. Hinzman

author: obits@timesonline.com
title: Karen G. Hinzman
text:
0 
Karen G. Hinzman, 72, of Brighton Township, passed away on Monday, October 19, 2015, in her residence. 
She was born on December 4, 1942, in Ohioville and was the daughter of the late John L. and Naomi M. (Dawson) Tresler. She was a retired nurse's aide of 30 plus years at Friendship Ridge, formerly the Beaver Valley Geriatric Center. She enjoyed flea marketing and her friends at the Rochester Salvation Army. In 2006 she was diagnosed with breast cancer. After years of battling through treatment, she beat the disease. 
She is survived by a daughter, Teresa (Donald) Cook of Darlington; a son, Robert J. (Elizabeth Moses) Hinzman of Freedom; four grandchildren, Kristen, Jessica and Matthew Cook of Darlington and James R. Hinzman of Freedom; a brother, Rodney (Karen) Tresler of Calcutta, OH; a sister, Winnie (Alice Betke) Tresler of Ohioville, and several nieces and nephews. 
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her ex-husband, James R. Hinzman; her sister, Rolena Renn; her brother-in-law, Donald W. Renn; her son, John Hinzman, and her nephews, Gail Renn and Donald W. Renn Jr 
Friends will be received on Saturday from 2 to 4 and 6 p.m. until the time of service at 8 p.m. in the GABAUER-LUTTON FUNERAL HOME & CREMATION SERVICES, INC., 117 Blackhawk Road, Chippewa Twp., www.gabauerluttonfuneralhome.com . Envoy John Barnett will officiate. 
Private interment will take place in Highland Cemetery. 
The family asks that contributions be made in Karen's name to the Salvation Army, 378 Jefferson St., Rochester, PA 15074.
